Key Arguments: The government should not be the arbiter of truth as it contradicts the goal of protecting democracy, society, and the economy.
The bill's approach to control is evident and unjustified.
Censorship poses a greater threat than misinformation and disinformation.
The government should focus on improving its own messaging rather than censoring dissenting voices.
Involving private corporations under threat of penalties will lead to excessive censorship.
Using private corporations for enforcement reduces accountability and recourse for decisions made.
Main Themes: Role of private corporations in enforcement
Notable Quotes: The Australian Government should not legislate itself, nor any regulatory body, the arbiter of truth.
The road to the curtailing of public discourse is not one this nation ought to be set on.
